page.title: 04OLD BUILDINGS
page.content: The Smiths arms is a pub and it is in Town Gate. It was built in the 17th century. Number 46 and 48 are weavers cottages. They were made in 1727 by John Turner. The market cross steps were made in the 14th century but the stand and the cross were made in the 18th century. The cross was made to show people where the market was held. They used to have the market at the church but it was so rough the bishop said they had to move by a week or the market would be closed down so the market moved over to Highburton. The Croft House was 200 years old in 1985.It was built as a barn and it had an extension in 1975 when the Varlow family took over. The house and grounds were improved a lot recently. The community centre used to be our school. In 1981 when the school was 100 years old a new school opened.
